pull.title: depends: Fix Qt build with XCode 9.3
pull.body:
Building Qt with Xcode 9.3 is currently broken with:
```
compiling kernel/qmacgesturerecognizer.cpp
fontdatabases/mac/qfontengine_coretext.mm:775:20: error: qualified reference to 'QFixed' is a constructor name rather than a type in this context
    return QFixed::QFixed(int(CTFontGetUnitsPerEm(ctfont)));
                   ^
compiling .moc/moc_qfbscreen_p.cpp
1 error generated.
make[2]: *** [.obj/qfontengine_coretext.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....

```
This patch should fix that, and will hopefully be the last time we have to patch Qt 5.7.

I've only made minor adjustments from the [original patch](https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/224900/), so that it will apply, although still not completely cleanly. We can cleanup if required.

events.message: depends: Fix Qt build with XCode 9.3

events.body:
I was initially confused by the PR description into thinking bitcoin-qt didn't build, but you're referring to QT itself via the depends system.

I didn't try before updating the command line tools in Xcode 9.3, but indeed building QT on macOS 10.13.4 is broken for me:

```
cd depends
make
...
compiling util/qundoview.cpp
rm -f ../../lib/libQt5Widgets.a
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ar cq ../../lib/libQt5Widgets.a .obj/qaction.o .obj/qactiongroup.o .obj/qapplication.o
...
.obj/moc_qmacstyle_mac_p.o .obj/moc_qmacnativewidget_mac.o .obj/moc_qmaccocoaviewcontainer_mac.o
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: ../../lib/libQt5Widgets.a(qstylepainter.o) has no symbols
...
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: ../../lib/libQt5Widgets.a(qscroller_mac.o) has no symbols
make: *** [/Volumes/SSD/src/bitcoin/depends/work/build/x86_64-apple-darwin17.5.0/qt/5.7.1-78660355bf0/qtbase/.stamp_built] Error 2
```

This PR fixes it for me.

issue.title: depends: Upgrade Qt to 5.9.6
issue.body: With the introduction of Ubuntu 18.04 (Bionic Beaver) modern versions of gcc and mingw that allow cross compilation of versions of Qt greater than 5.8 are now readily available. This pull requests upgrades the Qt depends recipe from Qt 5.7.1 to Qt 5.9.6. Qt 5.9.x is the current LTS version and should be supported by Qt until 2020.

issue.title: [0.16] Backports
issue.body:
Backports:
- #12626 Limit the number of IPs addrman learns from each DNS seeder
- #12650 gui: Fix issue: "default port not shown correctly in settings dialog"
- #12756 [config] Remove blockmaxsize option
- #12985 Windows: Avoid launching as admin when NSIS installer ends.
- #12946 depends: Fix Qt build with XCode 9.3
- #12998 Default to defining endian-conversion DECLs in compat w/o config
- #12999 qt: Show the Window when double clicking the taskbar icon
- #13064 List support for BIP173 in bips.md

to the 0.16 branch.

issue.title: Increase macOS minimum target to 10.9
issue.body:
Some C++11 calls added in recent commits (e.g., atomic_store()) don't appear to be in the libraries included with macOS 10.8. It's arguable if anybody out there is running Armory on 10.8. Therefore, instead of reworking the code, just increase the macOS minimum to 10.9. In addition, other actions were required in order to get Armory to run across various platforms.

- An obscure bug in Crypto++ 5.6.2 prevents the linker from building a vtable for some SHA classes in macOS, thereby causing startup failures. Move Crypto++ back to being a static library.
- Force the Crypto++ library to be included in an install.
- Use install_name_tool to make various libraries usable from relative locations, and not just from the point where they were compiled.
- Moved files into Armory's "common" shared library in order to resolve startup failures.
- Rearranged, cleaned up, modified, and disentangled various build variables, mostly related to variables being added two or three times.
- Due to macOS requirements, force the macOS build to always use libc++ instead of allowing for libstdc++. (Linux and Windows builds are unchanged.)
- Allow the macOS build script to properly rebuild Armory instead of wasting 20+ minutes rebuilding the prerequisites every time.
- Xcode 9.3 updates to clang 9.1, which breaks the Qt4 build. Patch Qt4 in order to let Qt4 build.
- brew has switched "python" over to Python 3. This breaks the build script. Force usage of Python 2 as is appropriate.

issue.title: [0.15] backport: depends qt patches
issue.body: Backports #11995 and #12946 so that qt (and all depends) can still be built on the 0.15 branch.
